main event: Two oblong, basketball-sized objects with four yellow lights on each were observed standing still and very high in the sky over East Gary, Indiana in November 1956.
interesting points: The objects were described as brilliant white in color.
The sighting was reported by a civilian witness, but the report notes that the witness statements were not completed.
The sighting was initially considered as possibly being an astronomical event, but no evaluation was made on the data presented.
The objects were reported to be standing still and very high in the sky.
The objects were reported to have four yellow lights on each of the two observed objects.
sighted object: two oblong, basketball-sized objects with four yellow lights on each
